Description: Mould-made plaster figure (fragment: torso) of female figure holding a flower.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

See parallel from Memphis, dated to the 25th Dynasty (Petrie Museum UC50460). See early Ptolemaic parallel from Ras el-Soda (Adriani 1952, pl.23.8). Adriani, A. 1952, Municipalité d’Alexandrie, Annuaire du Musée Gréco-Romain. Volume III (1940-1950), Alexandria.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (CE.193) (Phase 3)
